children.description: Default colors for themes. You can use any color anywhere, all colors change with the theme. If you want to customize your colors, please read use-theme to learn more. Get palette from useTheme.}>

children.name: Scale
children.description: The scalable nature of the Himalya gives great flexibility to each component. children.name: Text
children.description: The Text component allows you to display text with standardized typographic styles. It serves as the foundation for presenting textual content in your application or website.

children.name: Button
children.description: The Button UI component is a versatile element for triggering various operations within your application. It offers a range of features and states to suit your needs:

children.name: Carousel
children.description: The Carousel UI component is a powerful tool for adding interactive sliders to your web pages. It offers a wide range of customization options and features, including:

children.name: Code
children.description: The Code UI component serves as a versatile tool for displaying source code in a standardized and visually appealing way. Want to display shell code snippets? try Snippet.

children.name: Hero
children.description: The Hero UI component is a visually striking element designed to draw attention to featured content or key sections of a web page. It typically consists of the following components:

children.name: Icons
children.description: The Icon component is a dynamic tool for effortlessly incorporating over 350 semantic vector SVG graphics into your web app, elevating its visual impact and functionality.

children.name: Running Text
children.description: The RunningText UI component utilizes a margin animation to smoothly move text from left to right. This eye-catching effect adds dynamic motion to text, making it a compelling way to convey messages or information in web applications or websites.

children.name: Video
children.description: The Video UI component provides a versatile way to display video content on your website or application.

children.name: Box
children.description: The Box UI component is a versatile and scalable element that can adapt to various use cases within your web application.

children.name: Page
children.description: Container of general for display page content.

children.name: Entity
children.description: The Entity UI component is designed to display a collection of related information for a resource entity. It provides a structured and visually appealing way to present data about an entity.

children.name: Footer
children.description: The Footer UI component is a versatile element designed to be placed at the bottom of a web page or section, typically used for navigation, contact information, or additional content.

children.name: Gradient Content
children.description: The GradientContent UI component enables gradient backgrounds and lazy-loaded images to enhance your web application's visual appeal.

children.name: Grid
children.description: Powerful fluid style layout container. The Grid component uses dynamic CSS media query to implement responsive layout, It has ultra-high performance and very small size. Of course, it still supports dynamic props and custom breakpoints.

children.name: Header
children.description: The Header UI component provides a customizable header section for your web application, with options for creating a visually appealing and functional top bar.

children.name: Inner scroll
children.description: The InnerScroll component is a flexible element that empowers your content with scrollable capabilities. Whether you need vertical, horizontal, or both directions, InnerScroll can adapt to your content requirements, making it an invaluable addition to your layout.

children.name: Section
children.description: The Section UI component offers a versatile container for organizing and structuring content in your web application.

children.name: Show More
children.description: Styling component to show expanded or collapsed content.

children.name: Sidebar
children.description: Display a sidebar

children.name: Spacer
children.description: Provide empty space.

children.name: Card
children.description: A common container component.

children.name: Collapse
children.description: Display large amounts of text in collapsible sections. Commonly referred to as an accordion.

children.name: Fieldset
children.description: Display a collection of related information in a single unit.

children.name: AutoComplete
children.description: AutoComplete control of input field.

children.name: Button Group
children.description: A set of related buttons.

children.name: Checkbox
children.description: Displays a boolean value.

children.name: Input
children.description: Retrieve text input from a user. The Input contain an additional Hooks, see subsection useInput for details.

children.name: Radio
children.description: Provides single user input from a selection of options.

children.name: Select
children.description: Display a dropdown list of items. The Select contain an additional Hooks, see subsection useModal for details.

children.name: Slider
children.description: Display the current value and an inputable range.

children.name: Textarea
children.description: Retrieve multi-line user input.

children.name: Toggle
children.description: Displays a boolean value.

children.name: Toggle List
children.description: Displays a toggle list event

children.name: Avatar
children.description: Avatars represent a user or a team. Stacked avatars represent a group of people.

children.name: Badge
children.description: Display an indicator that requires attention.

children.name: Capacity
children.description: Display an capacity indicator.

children.name: Count Up
children.description: Countup is used to show animation counter

children.name: Description
children.description: Display brief information with a title and description.

children.name: Display
children.description: To display important information or images in a central alignment.

children.name: Dot
children.description: Display an indicator of standardization status.

children.name: File Tree
children.description: Display a list of files and folders in a hierarchical tree structure.

children.name: Image
children.description: Display image content.

children.name: Keyboard
children.description: Display keyboard input that triggers an action. The Keyboard can only display layout styles, if you need to bind the keyboard events, please read subsection useKeyboard.

children.name: Menu
children.description: Easily create and customize menus for your applications with the Menu UI component.

children.name: Popover
children.description: The floating box popped by clicking or hovering.

children.name: Skeleton
children.description: Show a placeholder in place of content that is loading.

children.name: Table
children.description: Display tabular data in format.

children.name: Tag
children.description: Display a unique keyword, optionally as a part of a set.

children.name: Tooltip
children.description: Displays additional information on hover.

children.name: User
children.description: Display user profile or social information.

children.name: Drawer
children.description: An interactive element fixed to the edge of the screen.

children.name: Gauge
children.description: Display Gauge UI component to show progress.

children.name: Loading spinner
children.description: Indicate an action running in the background.

children.name: Modal
children.description: Display popup content that requires attention or provides additional information. If you just need to prompt for a text message, try component Toast. The Modal contain an additional Hooks, see subsection useModal for details.

children.name: Note
children.description: Display text that requires attention or provides additional information.

children.name: Progress
children.description: Display progress relative to a limit or related to a task.

children.name: Rating
children.description: Display an indicator of rankings with stars.

children.name: Spinner
children.description: Indicate an action running in the background. As an indicator of load waiting, see also component Loading.

children.name: Toast
children.description: The Toast component only supports Hooks calls, please see the useToast documentation for details.

children.name: Bottom Navigation
children.description: Fixed BottomNavigation UI component designed for mobile devices, providing seamless and accessible navigation.

children.name: Breadcrumbs
children.description: Show where users are in the application.

children.name: Link
children.description: Hyperlinks between pages.

children.name: Mobile Menu
children.description: Create mobile-friendly navigation menus with ease using the MobileMenu UI component.

children.name: Navigation
children.description: Navigation Effortlessly create navigation menus, including sub-menus and child items, using the Navigation UI component.

children.name: Pagination
children.description: Navigation and identification between multiple pages.

children.name: Quick Bar
children.description: QuickBar is a customizable sidebar component designed for navigation .

children.name: Routing Indicator
children.description: The RoutingIndicator UI component provides visual feedback during page transitions, enhancing the user experience by showing the progress of navigation.

children.name: Tabs
children.description: Display tab content. The Tabs contain an additional Hooks, see subsection useTabs for details.

children.name: Button Dropdown
children.description: Display related but alternate actions for a button.

children.name: Animated Cursor
children.description: An AnimatedCursor UI component to customizable cursor animations for interactivity.

children.name: Divider
children.description: A divider line separates different content.

children.name: Search
children.description: The Search UI component provides a flexible and customizable search modal for web applications.

children.name: Snippet
children.description: Display a snippet of copyable code for the command line.

children.name: Fade-In Effect
children.description: A Fade-in UI Component for stunning fade-in animations and captivating visual effects.

children.name: Gradient Word
children.description: The GradientWord UI component adds captivating gradient effects to text, enhancing your web application with dynamic and colorful typography.

children.name: Charts
children.description: Charts creates interactive financial charts.

children.name: useKeyboard
children.description: React hooks for listen to multiple keyboard events.

children.name: useInput
children.description: useInput provides automatic binding for component Input, which can reduce the amount of repetitive code and improve the development experience. Using this hooks behaves the same as if you had added React.useState manually.

children.name: useModal
children.description: useModal provides automatic binding for component Modal, which can reduce the amount of repetitive code and improve the development experience. Using this hooks behaves the same as if you had added React.useState manually. This hooks also supports use on Select component.

children.name: useTabs
children.description: useTabs provides automatic binding for component Tabs, which can reduce the amount of repetitive code and improve the development experience. Using this hooks behaves the same as if you had added React.useState manually.

children.name: useToast
children.description: Display an important message globally.

children.name: useBodyScroll
children.description: Disable scrolling behavior for body or any element, it is useful for displaying popup element or menus. If the page's scrollbar is set to a user-defined width before scrolling is disabled, a paddingRight value will be added after disabling to adapt.

children.name: useClickAway
children.description: Detect if a click event happened outside an element. This is custom React hooks, you need to follow the Basic Rules when you use it.

children.name: useClipboard
children.description: Copy string to clipboard. This is custom React hooks, you need to follow the Basic Rules when you use it.

children.name: useMediaQuery
children.description: CSS media query hooks, it is implemented through the MediaQuery API. If you just want to build the layout, try Grid Component. This is custom React hooks, you need to follow the Basic Rules when you use it.

children.name: useSidebar
children.description: Simplify Sidebar Control. The useSidebar hook grants access to the sidebar state, allowing you to effortlessly manage and control the visibility and behavior of a sidebar component.

children.name: useCurrentState
children.description: Get the latest value in functional component. By default, state in a React function component can only get the value at render time, not the latest. This is a small tool to get the latest value, It is very useful in async actions such as setTimeout. if you like a bigger solution, try useReducer…

children.name: useScale
children.description: Remember the elastic scaling feature mentioned in the scale subsection, which gave the Himalya components amazing imagination and extensibility, and now you can add elastic scaling features to your own components with the help of the useScale hooks. children.name: useClasses
children.description: Technically, this is not a hooks, it just uses the nomenclature of hooks as well. useClasses is used to mix strings, objects, expressions, etc. into class-names, and remove the extra space characters. It is actually similar in function to classnames, but much more compact and lower of size. The…
